args: On the way back to the Halidom after dispatching a\npack of fiends, Panther and her friends stop by a\nsmall village to seek shelter for the night...
Oh, but this is terrible! What to do,\nwhat to do...?
The people here look pretty bummed out.\nI wonder what happened?
Hello, travelers. Are you new here?
Sure are. We were hoping to find a place\nto spend the night, but, uh...
Well, it seems like you guys have more\npressing concerns. What's going on?
I fear a dragon recently arrived at our\nvillage out of the blue and demanded...\na human sacrifice.
What?! You guys told me dragons\nwere your friends!
Plus, all the ones I met at the Halidom\nwere super nice. Definitely didn't seem\nlike the human sacrifice kinda folks.
There are all kinds of dragons, just like\nthere are all kinds of people—and some\nof 'em aren't the biggest fans of humans.
Well, sure...but can't we\ntalk them out of it?
No! What if you anger it?!
Oh, right. Wouldn't really help if the\nhuge dragon went on a rampage, huh.
You misunderstand, Panther. People in\nthis world—and especially we humans—\nworship dragons.

They are masters of nature and mana,
which makes them special among all
living things. But as they bring bounty,
they can also rain down wrath.
Even a child knows that without dragons,\nour fields would wither and our rivers rot!
We're at their mercy, and we've no choice\nsave to obey them and pray for clemency.
So if some dragon stomps over and tells\nyou to start feeding it your friends, you\njust lie down and do it?!
Such is the natural law and reality of\nour world, as grim as it might seem.
I mean, I get that it's a rule, but...
(...But an outsider like me should probably\njust keep her big mouth shut.)
(Still, is that really the right thing to do?)
Huh? What are those two doing?
No, you have to live! That's why I'm\ngoing to offer myself up in your place!
No! I was the one who got chosen;\nthere's no reason you should die!
How can I live with myself if I let my\nbest friend die in order to save me?!
(Oh no... They're just like I was!)
(I was trying to sacrifice myself for Shiho,\nand Shiho was doing the same for me...)
(We both told ourselves it didn't matter\nwhat happened to us so long as our friend\nwas safe...)
Okay, that does it! I'm gonna go tell this\nstupid dragon to knock it off already!
And nobody better try to stop me!\nEven if I go alone, I have to—
Stop you? I'm coming WITH you!
Huh? But I thought... What happened to\n＂this world's natural law＂ and all that?
Do I seriously strike you as the kinda\nguy who cares about the rules?
I've got a thing or nine I wanna say to this\ndragon, so I'm right behind you!
Both of you, listen to reason and... *sigh*\nI should know better than to try by now.\nIn that case, let us all go together.
Someone needs to be there to prevent\nmatters from truly getting out of hand.
Thanks, guys! I feel way better knowing\nyou've got my back in all this.
Hey, dragon! You in there, buddy?\nCome on out for a second, yeah?
(Ugh, that thing's even scarier than\nI was expecting!)
(But now's not the time to be afraid.\nI need to really let this thing have it!)
Er, excuse me? Yeah, you there.\nWe need to talk to you a minute!
You have business with Stribog? Very well.\nThen you are most welcome here.
Now see here! We're...uh... Wow.\nI didn't expect you to sound like\nsuch a gentleman.
Yeah, I figured a dragon who demanded\nhuman sacrifices would be a little more...\nyou know. Rough and tumble?
I beg your pardon? Human sacrifice?
Yeah, you told the village they had to give\nyou a human sacrifice! ...Didn't you?
Hm? While I did visit the village recently,\nI certainly demanded nothing of the sort.\n
Oh, well that's great news! They must\nhave just misunderstood you.

Perhaps they did, at that. For you see,
while I have dwelled within this cave in
thoughtful meditation since antiquity,
the other day brought forth epiphany.

Might not conversation with those unlike
me—and specifically with children of
men—yield insights that introspection
alone cannot?

But when you requested a conversation
partner, the villagers jumped to the
conclusion that you were demanding
blood sacrifice.
They didn't jump to a conclusion so much\nas hurl themselves off a cliff of conclusion,\nbut sure. Whatever.
They must have been so startled to see\nthis guy that they panicked.
(I was pretty terrified too, after all...)
Nothing, I'm good. But we should hurry\nback to the village and clear things up.
It's back! The dragon is back!
I didn't expect it to be so soon...but I have\nto do this! I have to keep everyone safe!
No! If someone has to be sacrificed,\nlet it be me!
Everybody just hold on for a second!\nThe dragon doesn't want a sacrifice!
It's all in your heads, ya weirdos!
Phew, glad we ironed that all out.
Indeed, I am relieved our words were able\nto calm the villagers to the point where\nthey could hear Stribog out.
I owe you my thanks for your aid;\nthe villagers and I arrived at a swift\narrangement as a result.
They will send conversation partners in\nshifts to my dwelling, a development\nfor which I am most grateful.
I'm glad it all worked out!
And I'm glad for you two as well.
I know! Now we have so much more time\nto spend together!
(There's no treasure quite like the time\nyou spend with your friends.)
